SEARCH
Package menu

Class ApplicantMenu

java.lang.Object
menu.ApplicantMenu
public class ApplicantMenu extends Object
Menu interface for Applicant users in the BTO Management System. Provides functionality for browsing projects, submitting applications, managing enquiries, and handling withdrawal requests.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • ApplicantMenu

      public ApplicantMenu(Applicant applicant, ApplicantProjectFeatures projectFacade, ApplicantApplicationFeatures appFacade, ApplicantEnquiryFeatures enquiryFacade, ApplicantWithdrawalFeatures withdrawalFacade)
      Constructor for the ApplicantMenu. Initializes the menu with the current applicant and necessary data handlers.
      Parameters:
      applicant - The currently logged in applicant
      projectFacade - Handler for project-related operations
      appFacade - Handler for application-related operations
      enquiryFacade - Handler for enquiry-related operations
      withdrawalFacade - Handler for withdrawal-related operations

  • Method Details

    • display

      public boolean display()
      Displays the Applicant Menu and handles user interactions.
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses to switch to Officer Mode (for HDB Officers only), false if the user chooses to logout.

    • browseProjects

      private void browseProjects()
      Displays the project browsing menu and handles project filtering options. Allows users to view all available projects or filter by neighborhood, flat type, or price range.

    • filterProjectsByNeighborhood

      private List<Project> filterProjectsByNeighborhood(List<Project> projects, String neighborhood)
      Filters projects by neighborhood name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to filter
      neighborhood - Neighborhood name to search for
      Returns:
      List of projects in the specified neighborhood

    • filterProjectsByFlatType

      private List<Project> filterProjectsByFlatType(List<Project> projects, String flatType)
      Filters projects that have the specified flat type available.
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to filter
      flatType - Flat type to search for (e.g., "2-Room", "3-Room")
      Returns:
      List of projects that have the specified flat type

    • filterProjectsByPriceRange

      private List<Project> filterProjectsByPriceRange(List<Project> projects, double minPrice, double maxPrice)
      Filters projects by unit price range.
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to filter
      minPrice - Minimum price threshold
      maxPrice - Maximum price threshold
      Returns:
      List of projects with unit prices within the specified range

    • displayProjects

      private boolean displayProjects(List<Project> projects)
      Displays a list of eligible projects based on applicant's marital status and age. Shows detailed information and allows selecting a project to view more details.
      Parameters:
      projects - List of projects to display
      Returns:
      true if the user wants to continue browsing projects, false otherwise

    • hasOfficerRegistrationForProject

      private boolean hasOfficerRegistrationForProject(String projectName)
      Check if the applicant (who is also an officer) has any pending or approved registration for a specific project. Officers cannot apply for projects they're registered to handle.
      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the project to check
      Returns:
      true if the applicant has registered for the project as an officer, false otherwise

    • submitApplication

      private void submitApplication()
      Handles the application submission process. Checks eligibility, guides flat type selection based on marital status and age, and creates an application record in the system.

    • viewApplicationStatus

      private void viewApplicationStatus()
      Displays the applicant's submitted applications and their statuses. Allows viewing detailed information about a selected application.

    • manageEnquiries

      private void manageEnquiries()
      Displays the enquiry management submenu and handles user interactions. Provides options for submitting, viewing, editing, and deleting enquiries.

    • submitEnquiry

      private void submitEnquiry()
      Handles the process of submitting a new enquiry. Allows the user to select a project and enter their enquiry message.

    • viewEnquiries

      private void viewEnquiries()
      Displays all enquiries submitted by the current applicant. Shows enquiry details including status and any responses received.

    • editEnquiry

      private void editEnquiry()
      Allows the applicant to edit a pending (not yet responded to) enquiry. Only enquiries that haven't received a response can be edited.

    • deleteEnquiry

      private void deleteEnquiry()
      Allows the applicant to delete a pending (not yet responded to) enquiry. Only enquiries that haven't received a response can be deleted.

    • manageWithdrawal

      private void manageWithdrawal()
      Displays the withdrawal management submenu and handles user interactions. Provides options for submitting withdrawal requests and viewing existing ones.

    • submitWithdrawalRequest

      private void submitWithdrawalRequest()
      Handles the process of submitting a withdrawal request for an existing application. Checks eligibility and guides the applicant through the withdrawal request process.

    • viewWithdrawalRequests

      private void viewWithdrawalRequests()
      Displays all withdrawal requests submitted by the current applicant. Shows detailed information about the status of each withdrawal request.

    • changePassword

      private void changePassword()
      Handles the password change process for the current applicant. Verifies the current password and updates it with a new one.

    • printHeader

      private void printHeader(String title)
      Prints a formatted header with the specified title.
      Parameters:
      title - The title to display in the header

    • printDivider

      private void printDivider()
      Prints a horizontal divider line for visual separation in the UI.

    • printMessage

      private void printMessage(String message)
      Prints an informational message with appropriate formatting.
      Parameters:
      message - The information message to display

    • printSuccess

      private void printSuccess(String message)
      Prints a success message with appropriate formatting.
      Parameters:
      message - The success message to display

    • printError

      private void printError(String message)
      Prints an error message with appropriate formatting.
      Parameters:
      message - The error message to display

    • readChoice

      private int readChoice(int min, int max)
      Reads a numeric choice from user input with validation.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum acceptable value
      max - The maximum acceptable value
      Returns:
      The user's choice, or -1 if input was invalid

    • readDouble

      private double readDouble()
      Reads a decimal number from user input.
      Returns:
      The parsed double value, or -1 if input was invalid

    • readYesNo

      private boolean readYesNo()
      Reads a yes/no response from the user with a default prompt.
      Returns:
      true for yes/y, false for any other input

    • readYesNo

      private boolean readYesNo(String prompt)
      Reads a yes/no response from the user with a custom prompt.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt to display to the user
      Returns:
      true for yes/y, false for any other input

    • truncate

      private String truncate(String str, int length)
      Truncates a string to the specified length for display purposes.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to truncate
      length - The maximum length
      Returns:
      The truncated string
